subject: Re: [junit] Exception Error
msgSnippet: ... Hint: check carefully the package number of the test runner. Google JUnit: A Starter Guide if you need help knowing the correct package name. J. B.
messageBody:
>So said anupama on 2003-06-21 --------------------
>hi,
>
>Sorry i couldn't understand the procedure which u have asked me to do.I
>have placed all my files in the same directory of junit3.8.1.In
>junit3.8.1,junit (samples folder),junit.jar and src.jar files are placed.
>
>Actually i have set the path as<
>C:\j2sdk1.4.0_02\lib;C:\junit3.8.1\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;\C:\Documents and
>Settings\Anupama\Desktop\Junit3.8.1\junit3.8.1\junit\samples>
>
>After compiling i am running AllTests.java file in command prompt as
>c:\java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests.After running it is
>displaying an error as"Exception in thread "main"
>java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:junit/Textui/TestRunner
>
>Please give me the solution.

Hint: check carefully the package number of the test runner. Google "JUnit: A Starter Guide" if you need help knowing the correct package name.




J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
